questions.question: If no specific orientation is given for the valve stem, how should the stem in a gate valve be oriented when installed in a horizontal line?
options: It should be installed with the valve stem in the horizontal position.
It should be installed with the valve stem in the vertical down position.
It should be installed at a 45-degree angle.
It is recommended to be installed with the valve stem set in the vertical up position.
It does not matter how the valve stem is oriented.
correctAnswer: It is recommended to be installed with the valve stem set in the vertical up position.

questions.question: What special feature might be required for a gate valve installed in a vertical line?
options: An additional support bracket for stability.
A pressure relief valve to prevent overpressure.
A flow indicator to monitor flow direction.
A locking mechanism to secure the valve position.
A drain tapping in the valve body to provide drainage of the line above the disc.
correctAnswer: A drain tapping in the valve body to provide drainage of the line above the disc.

questions.question: What is the last thing the installer should do to complete the installation of a valve in a line?
options: The valve should be cleaned and lubricated.
The valve should be operated through a complete cycle after it has been installed.
The valve should be painted to prevent corrosion.
The valve should be pressure-tested for leaks.
The valve should be marked with an identification tag.
correctAnswer: The valve should be operated through a complete cycle after it has been installed.

questions.question: What is the function of the valve stem when opening a globe valve that has pressure under the disc?
options: The valve stem acts to control the rate at which the disc moves up from the seat.
The valve stem provides support to the valve body.
The valve stem maintains the alignment of the valve.
The valve stem releases pressure from the valve.
The valve stem prevents backflow in the system.
correctAnswer: The valve stem acts to control the rate at which the disc moves up from the seat.

questions.question: What key factor does the valve manufacturer need to know to ensure that a swing check valve will operate in the full open position?
options: The manufacturer needs to know the pressure of the fluid in the line.
The manufacturer needs to know the temperature of the fluid in the line.
The manufacturer needs to know the viscosity of the fluid in the line.
The manufacturer needs to know the type of fluid in the line.
The manufacturer needs to know the velocity of the fluid in the line.
correctAnswer: The manufacturer needs to know the velocity of the fluid in the line.

questions.question: Why would a tilting disc check valve be chosen over the same size swing check valve?
options: A tilting disc check valve will operate at very low velocities.
A tilting disc check valve is less expensive.
A tilting disc check valve is easier to install.
A tilting disc check valve has a longer lifespan.
A tilting disc check valve requires less maintenance.
correctAnswer: A tilting disc check valve will operate at very low velocities.

questions.question: What flow condition can be reduced or eliminated with the use of a spring-loaded check valve?
A valve is found with leakage through the bonnet connection. When the valve bonnet is removed, you find the gasket damaged. What is the recommended repair?
options: Reinstall the bonnet with the damaged gasket.

questions.question: A valve is failing frequently in service. The seats are damaged and have to be changed frequently. What is the probable cause and suggested solution to this problem?
options: The valve is installed incorrectly. Reinstall the valve.
The seat material is too soft. Replace with a harder seat.
The operating pressure is too high. Reduce the pressure.
The valve is not being lubricated. Apply lubrication.
The fluid is too corrosive. Change the fluid type.
correctAnswer: The seat material is too soft. Replace with a harder seat.

questions.question: What is required in most plants before any component can be removed from a system or piece of equipment?
The most common service done on gate or globe valves is to repack the stuffing boxes. Why would a safe work permit have to be obtained to repack a valve stuffing box?
options: Even though this procedure does not involve actual entry into the system, the packing is the seal between system product and the outside environment.
Because the valve must be completely disassembled.
To ensure the correct tools are used.
To confirm the availability of replacement parts.
To verify the valve's serial number and specifications.
correctAnswer: Even though this procedure does not involve actual entry into the system, the packing is the seal between system product and the outside environment.

questions.question: What is the correct packing size to use if the valve stem measures 19 mm (3/4'') OD and the stuffing box measures 32 mm (1 1/4'')?
What should be done with coil or spiral packing before inserting it into the stuffing box?
options: Compress the packing into a solid ring.
Heat the packing to soften it.
Twist the packing into a tighter coil.
Cut the packing into separate rings.
correctAnswer: Cut the packing into separate rings.

questions.question: If butt-cut rings are cut on a flat surface, what should be done to ensure that the end cut of the rings can be reproduced accurately?
options: Be certain that the side of the ring, and not the OD or ID surface, is laid on the rings to be cut.
Measure the rings with a caliper before cutting.
Cut the rings at an angle to the surface.
Use a template to guide the cutting.
Mark the rings with a permanent marker before cutting.
correctAnswer: Be certain that the side of the ring, and not the OD or ID surface, is laid on the rings to be cut.

questions.question: Which group is still considered to be at the forefront of valve standards activities?
options: The American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME)
The Manufacturers Standardization Society of the Valve & Fitting Industry (MSS).
The National Association of Corrosion Engineers (NACE)
correctAnswer: The Manufacturers Standardization Society of the Valve & Fitting Industry (MSS).

questions.question: Why would a chemical or refinery valve specifier reference an API 6D valve standard?
options: The testing requirements which differ slightly from API 598. The primary difference being 6D's zero allowable leakage on closure tests.
The materials used in API 6D valves are more durable.
API 6D valves are easier to install.
API 6D valves have a longer lifespan.
correctAnswer: The testing requirements which differ slightly from API 598. The primary difference being 6D's zero allowable leakage on closure tests.

questions.question: Which code or standard is most often referenced for chemical or refinery globe and check valve specifications?
List four (4) factors that should be considered when choosing the correct valve for an installation.
What feature of Y pattern and angle pattern globe valves allows them to be used in blowoff or blowdown service where mud or sludge has to be removed from a vessel?
options: Union bonnets allow for easy servicing.
The bonnet is isolated from the valve body by a diaphragm.

questions.question: The type of valve most widely used in industry is the _______________ valve.
Why is this valve most widely used in industry?
options: This valve is most widely used in industry because it is the cheapest option.
This valve is most widely used in industry because it offers a higher rate of flow than other valve designs, it offers quick and easy operation, it is simple in design and requires less maintenance.
This valve is most widely used in industry because it is the smallest in size.
This valve is most widely used in industry because it can handle the highest pressure.
This valve is most widely used in industry because it is the oldest design.
correctAnswer: This valve is most widely used in industry because it offers a higher rate of flow than other valve designs, it offers quick and easy operation, it is simple in design and requires less maintenance.

questions.question: Check valves are designed to ____________________________.
List the two (2) main types of check valves.
Why would you use a globe valve instead of a gate valve?
What is the recommended position that a valve should be installed?
options: With the stem in the upright position.
With the stem in the horizontal position.
With the stem in the downward position.
In any position as long as it fits.
correctAnswer: With the stem in the upright position.

questions.question: What is meant by equivalent length?
options: The loss of pressure in the line caused by the valve or fitting in relationship to a length of pipe.
The actual length of the valve or fitting.
The diameter of the valve or fitting.
The weight of the valve or fitting.
The flow rate through the valve or fitting.
correctAnswer: The loss of pressure in the line caused by the valve or fitting in relationship to a length of pipe.

The difference between the restriction (relative to the equivalent length of pipe) of a 3/4'' gate valve fully open and a 3/4'' straight pattern globe valve fully open is ______.
The difference between the restriction of a 2'' gate valve and a 2'' straight pattern globe valve fully open is ______.
State the meaning of the following abbreviations: NRS:

questions.question: State the meaning of the following abbreviations: AWWA:
options: 125 psi maximum operating pressure (water, oil, or gas)

questions.question: State the meaning of the following abbreviations: RS:
options: 125 psi maximum operating pressure (water, oil, or gas)

questions.question: State the meaning of the following abbreviations: WOG:
options: 125 psi maximum operating pressure (water, oil, or gas)

questions.question: State the meaning of the following abbreviations: S:
options: 125 psi maximum operating pressure (water, oil, or gas)

questions.question: State the meaning of the following abbreviations: 125WOG:
options: 125 psi maximum operating pressure (water, oil, or gas)
correctAnswer: 125 psi maximum operating pressure (water, oil, or gas)

questions.question: State the meaning of the following abbreviations: 125S:
options: 125 psi maximum operating pressure (water, oil, or gas)

questions.question: What type of valve is most suited to throttling?
What is the function of a ball valve and under what service conditions would it be used?
options: A ball valve is used to start and stop the flow of fluids. It can be used in almost any application (gas, water, steam, sewage, and oil to name a few).
A ball valve is used for throttling fluid flow. It is best used in high-temperature applications.
A ball valve is used to prevent backflow in the system. It is suitable for low-pressure applications.
A ball valve is used to regulate pressure. It is primarily used in steam systems.
A ball valve is used to filter impurities. It is ideal for use in sewage systems.
correctAnswer: A ball valve is used to start and stop the flow of fluids. It can be used in almost any application (gas, water, steam, sewage, and oil to name a few).

questions.question: What types and design of valves would be best suited for the following service applications?
options: laminar flow, non-throttled: Ball or gate valve.
restricted headroom non-throttling: Ball or non-rising stem gate valve.
change direction and throttle: Angle globe valve.
correctAnswer: laminar flow, non-throttled: Ball or gate valve.
restricted headroom non-throttling: Ball or non-rising stem gate valve.
change direction and throttle: Angle globe valve.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of an NRS valve?
options: It requires less headroom to operate.
correctAnswer: It requires less headroom to operate.
